reference.shortdesc: The hasKind element specifies that the contained hierarchy expresses KIND-OF relationships between subjects.

refbody.section: In a KIND-OF hierarchy, the child subject is a particular variety of the parent subject. A KIND-OF hierarchy is sometimes known as an IS-A, generic, or subsumption hierarchy.

example.title: Example
example.p: This example specifies that cities, towns, and villages are each a kind of settlement. Additionally, bigcity, mediumcity, and smallcity are each a kind of city.
example.codeblock: <subjectScheme> <hasKind> <subjectdef keys="settlement" navtitle="Human settlement"> <subjectdef keys="city" navtitle="City"> <subjectdef keys="bigcity" navtitle="Big city"/> <subjectdef keys="mediumcity" navtitle="Medium city"/> <subjectdef keys="smallcity" navtitle="Small city"/> </subjectdef> <subjectdef keys="town" navtitle="Town"/> <subjectdef keys="village" navtitle="Village"/> </subjectdef> </hasKind> </subjectScheme>
